p: The porcine pancreatic lipase inhibitory assay was conducted to evaluate the antilipase activity of N. obtusifolia five extracts in comparison with the positive control antilipase commercial drug orlistat. Table 2 and Figure 2 showed that all evaluated extracts have antilipase activity comparing with the positive control orlistat, while the acetone and methanol extracts revealed the highest and potent antilipase effect comparing with orlistat with IC 50 values of 30.19 ± 0.11, 33.11 ± 0.13, and 12.3 ± 0.35 μg/ml, respectively.
